dict.acceptation: 解雇，把…免职；遣散，解散（队伍等）；驳回，拒绝受理；搁置；

sent.orig: The defendant may also move to dismiss if the statute of limitations has expired.
sent.trans: 如果限制性的条例已经期限届满，被告也可以提议驳回。

sent.orig: And she at this moment, at one's own blood calmly, dismiss with a laugh.
sent.trans: 而此刻的她，平静地看着自己的鲜血，一笑置之。

sent.orig: Actually, the framework of Hua Youshi discipline is early too overstaffed, dismiss a half cannot cherish.
sent.trans: 实际上，华友世纪的架构早就过于臃肿，裁掉一半都不可惜。

sent.orig: His abrupt absence annoyed the manager, who even made a decision to dismiss him.
sent.trans: 他的突然缺席让经理很生气，他甚至决定要辞退他。

sent.orig: They dismiss the rumours as ridiculous.
sent.trans: 他们都否认那个可笑的传闻。
